intro: Cliffortia crassinervis, commonly known as the broad-veined cliffortia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its leaves are narrow and have prominent veins, giving it its scientific name. Cliffortia crassinervis is well adapted to arid conditions and is often used in gardens for its ornamental value.
